author: hwright
msg: First step toward supporting multiple checksum types.  Add a new datatype for
checksums, and appropriate setting and getting functions.  Rev the
svn_fs_file_md5_checksum() interface to allow it to return digests other
("Why is this happening on the fs-rep-sharing branch?" you ask.  Well,
currently, we use MD5 digests in the fs to make sure that the representation
is what we think it is.  MD5 works fine for that.  However, with representation
sharing, we are now using the checksum to detect duplicate representations and
only store the one of them.  Should somebody want to intentionally create
collisions in the database, MD5 is known to be vulnerable.  Hence the desire
to use something stronger, like SHA-1.)
(file_checksum_args): Use a checksum, instead of an MD5 digest.
(txn_body_file_checksum): Return the MD5 if requested, and all zeros if
(fs_file_md5_checksum, fs_file_checksum): Rename.  Return the MD5 if requested,
and all zeros if SHA-1 requested.

author: hwright
msg: JavaHL: Followup to r28973.  Add support for changelists to status().
(status): Add changelist parameter, use it for the C APIs.

author: cmpilato
msg: (tweak_status): Use the baton's changelist hash to filter unwanted statuses.
(svn_client_status3): Add 'changelists' parameter, and use it to
populate the 'changelist_hash' status wrapper function baton member.
Update status of the feature revamp.
